docTitle.titlePart:
Dynamic orchestration of distributed services
on interactive community displays: the ALIVE
approach

byline.docAuthor:
Gómez-Sebastià, I.*, Manel Palau**, Juan Carlos Nieves*, Javier Vázquez-
Salceda* and Luigi Ceccaroni**

front.address:
C/Marina 16-18, Torre Mapfre 28 A E08005 Barcelona,
Spain,
front.div:
Abstract Interconnected service providers constitute a highly dynamic, complex,
distributed environment. Multi-agent system design-methodologies have been try-
ing to address this kind of environments for a long time. The European project
ALIVE presents a framework of three interconnected levels that tackles this issue
relying on organisation and coordination techniques, as well as on developments
in the Web-services world. This paper presents initial results focused on a high-
tech, real use case: interactive community displays with touristic information and
services, dynamically personalized according to user preferences and local laws.
